meanings.definition: A person who opposes or resists something.
meanings.sent1: The opposers gathered outside the courthouse to protest the new law.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the class to identify the opposers of the proposed school trip.
meanings.sent3: The opposers of vegetables at the dinner table were met with a plate full of broccoli.
meanings.sent4: The opposers of change stood like a wall against progress.
meanings.sent5: The opposers in the movie wore capes and masks, fighting for justice.

meanings.definition: Those who are against or in conflict with a particular idea or action.
meanings.sent1: The opposers of the new policy voiced their concerns at the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The opposers of the project presented their arguments during the debate.
meanings.sent3: The opposers of early mornings were always late to work.
meanings.sent4: The opposers of the status quo shook the foundation of tradition.
meanings.sent5: The opposers in the play wore different colored hats to symbolize their disagreement.
